newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Shell to base global coal in Australia.
newsitem.headline: Shell to base global coal in Australia.

text.p: The Royal Dutch-Shell Group said on Thursday its global coal interests would be consolidated into a new wholly-owned international company, based in Australia.

The new company, Shell Coal, will oversee the group's coal businesses including exploration and mining as well as pursuing opportunities in coal-fired power generation, Shell Australia Ltd said in a statement.
Current coal corporate functions in London and Melbourne will be relocated to Brisbane, Queensland while coal marketing would continue from Sydney and London, a Shell spokesman said.

The decision to establish the new company in Australia followed a review of Shell's global coal business which confirmed the group had world-class assets and was in a strong position position to expand in hard coal markets and power generation, the spokesman said.
Shell was Australia's third biggest coal producer with management of the Drayton and Dartbrook thermal coal mines and South Bulli coking coal mine in New South Wales.
In Queensland, Shell had 66.7 percent of the Callide thermal coal mine and 46.75 percent of German Creek coking coal output.

Construction of the Moranbah North hard coking coal mine was underway in north Queensland with new developments including the Theodore and Dawson thermal coal deposits, Grosvenor coking coal deposit and a power generation project, the spokesman said.
In Venezuela, Shell had a 24.7 percent interest in a mine at Paso Diablo in Zulia and a similar interest in the nearby Sacuy reserves.
